p: In the laboratory space viral metagenomics consists of four major steps: (1) viral enrichment to minimize background of prokaryotic and eukaryotic nucleic acids thus increasing the relative proportion of viral nucleic acids, (2) amplification of viral nucleic acids, (3) sequencing with or without cloning of amplified polymerase chain reaction (PCR) fragments, and (4) bioinformatic analysis of the resulting sequence output ( Alavandi and Poornima, 2012, Delwart, 2007).
